form.name: selfcare_hygiene_two
form.page_subtitle: PNC Counselling: PNC Self-Care & Hygiene> Self-Care & Hygiene Two

field.name: Educate mother on the importance of good hygiene and hand washing
Good hygiene or cleanliness is important to avoid diarrhoea and other illness
Wash your hands with soap and water before preparing foods and feeding baby
Wash your hands and your baby’s before eating
Wash your hands with soap and water after using the toilet and washing or cleaning baby’s bottom
Feed your baby using clean hands, clean utensils and clean cups
Use a clean spoon or cup to give breast milk to your baby
Do not use bottles, teats or spouted cups since they are difficult to clean and can cause your baby to become sick
